history.content:
If you want databases, 162 may not be as helpful. The main thing we talked about that was database related was coherency stuff when you have distributed systems, but this was a super small portion of the course. Idk much about 186 since I haven't taken it, but I found 162 to be quite nontrivial workload wise. I would say, per project, maybe 30-40 hours, less if you have a stellar team (I felt I had an amazing team with good team chemistry and we finished projects in 10-15 hours). If you want to be certain about your team, make sure to find a group of competent people willing to join you. As for studying for exams and doing HWs, I would say the exams are mostly memorization (take this as you will, people memorize content at different speeds), and HWs have huge variance in time commitment. Some HWs are insanely short and doable in one afternoon and some HWs might take a couple of days. Luckily, HWs are biweekly, so it's manageable even on the heavier end. ------

I've taken both. They overlap in concurrency and distributed decision making, but each has many other separate stuffs. I'd recommend 186 over 162 since it has lower workload and easier exams, and concurrency and distributed decision making are probably the most important ideas in 162 that are already covered in 186. After 186, I don't feel like 162 is a must. 162 also covers memory, which is covered in 61C already, and file system, which is easy to learn on your own.

<md>If you want databases, 162 may not be as helpful. The main thing we talked about that was database related was coherency stuff when you have distributed systems, but this was a super small portion of the course. Idk much about 186 since I haven't taken it, but I found 162 to be quite nontrivial workload wise. I would say, per project, maybe 30-40 hours, less if you have a stellar team (I felt I had an amazing team with good team chemistry and we finished projects in 10-15 hours). If you want to be certain about your team, make sure to find a group of competent people willing to join you. As for studying for exams and doing HWs, I would say the exams are mostly memorization (take this as you will, people memorize content at different speeds), and HWs have huge variance in time commitment. Some HWs are insanely short and doable in one afternoon and some HWs might take a couple of days. Luckily, HWs are biweekly, so it's manageable even on the heavier end.</md>

children.subject: 162 covers everything you need to know in 186, and more. 186 was practically useless after having taken 162. 162 is hands down the better course. Indeed, it has a higher workload but is far more applicable in standard SWE jobs/interviews.

<md>If you're looking for a design course, 162 is a pretty beefy design course. If you don't care about the material and just want to knock out a requirement, I can't recommend 162. I think 161 might be a lighter option. A lot of my friends liked that course, but I haven't taken it yet. If you think robots are cool, maybe check out 106a</md>

Yeah I heard that 161 is relatively light and its grading is comforting. However, 161 is not that beneficial for theory side (well most of the design courses aren’t either). 186 and 162 at least cover some concepts that could be useful for future investigations.
<md>161 is potentially beneficial for the cryptography side. I know that CS 276 has 161 listed as a prereq</md>

Thank you guys for information above! 
Generally, I am more interested in the theory side of CS, while design course is a must for CS major. Currently I would prefer 186 since HKN lists it before 162. 
It would be helpful as well if you guys have any recommendations of design course for the theory side of CS!

history.content:
Since 162 involves database portion, I wonder how much of 186 would be covered in this section? Would the database portion in 162 be covered as a module or just be plugged in as a project?
Which class would be more beneficial? 
And, if possible, could you describe the workload of both courses (heavy/medium/light)?
Thanks in advance.
history.subject: CS 162 vs. CS 186?
